item.title: About
item.description: Presentation Hi there! I am a third year PhD student in the Physical Microfluidics and Bioengineering lab at the Pasteur Institute in Paris. At the PÎ¼B we develop new microfluidic setups and quantitative tools to study complex biological phenomena, such as yeast DNA repair mechanisms or the bacterial SOS response. My PhD project involves studying immune-tumor cell interactions in microfluidic chips. With advanced imaging pipelines and coupled with some additional mathematical modeling, we investigate how immune cells accumulate at tumor sites and how they successfully - or not - kill cancer cells.
